insertShortcutTable.caption: Diagram
insertShortcutTable.description: Use the ModelBuilder view shortcuts to navigate the model diagram and manage model elements.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Report
insertShortcutTable.description: Use the ModelBuilder Report view shortcuts to navigate the model report and interact with report elements.

insertProduct.caption: Spatial Analyst
insertProduct.description: Provides advanced spatial modeling and analysis tools for raster data. It is designed to solve complex problems such as modeling terrains, finding suitable locations, discovering spatial patterns, modeling distance and cost, performing hydrologic analysis, and statistical analysis for cell based data.

insertProduct.caption: Data Interoperability
insertProduct.description: Is an integrated spatial ETL (extract, transform, and load) toolset that runs within the geoprocessing framework using Safe Software's FME technology. It enables you to integrate data from multiple sources and formats, use that data with geoprocessing tools, and publish it.

filter.displayName: Oriented Imagery Layer and Layer Files

content.searchDescription: This skill class helps users create, retrieve, and open tools for data processing

aiAssistantFunction.name: OpenTool
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Open a geoprocessing tool for the user to help them process their data.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateToolBox
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: create a toolbox. A toolbox is used to store geoprocessing script and model tools for later use. Scripts and model tools are automated processes.

content.searchDescription: Create, retrieve and open model tools. A model can automating data processing

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateNewModel
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: create a model within a toolbox. Model tools are no code automated workflows used for storing tasks.

content.searchDescription: This skill class focuses on hydrological tasks, such as creating conditioned DEMs and analyzing flow direction and accumulation, returning relevant tool Id for each task

insertModule.caption: Geoprocessing

checkBox.caption: Enforce Link Flow
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The layout attempts to force all links to point to the same direction. If the arranged graph contains cycles, some of the links will still point backward.

checkBox.caption: Straighten Long Links
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The layout strives to straighten links that cross more than one layer of the graph. Because of the additional horizontal alignment constraints, the arranged graph usually occupies a larger area than when this setting is unchecked or False.

checkBox.caption: Orthogonal Links
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The connectors will follow orthogonal routes.

checkBox.caption: Show Grid
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The Layout shows reference grid.

checkBox.caption: Use Grid Router
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The layout uses a grid router to arrange model elements. This may slow layout performance depending on the number of nodes, connectors and the size of the model. Unchecked - The layout uses the default Quick Router. This is good for most of the cases and layout performance is faster. This is the recommended setting.

customControl.caption: Grid Size
customControl.extendedCaption: Set the value is used to set the size of the routing grid.
customControl.tooltip: The value is used to set the size of the routing grid. A smaller grid size will generate better results, but might slow layout performance depending on the number of nodes, connectors and the size of the model.

customControl.caption: Element
customControl.extendedCaption: Set distance between tools, variables, connectors and groups.
customControl.tooltip: The distance between tools, variables, connectors and groups.

customControl.caption: Level
customControl.extendedCaption: Set distance between stacked tools, variables and groups in the same graph.
customControl.tooltip: The distance between stacked tools, variables and groups in the same graph.

customControl.caption: Element
customControl.tooltip: The distance between separate or unconnected graphs.

button.caption: Bezier
button.tooltip: The shape of the connector used while drawing, or after Auto Layout is applied. The connector segments will be Bezier curves.

button.caption: Cascade
button.tooltip: The connector segments will be horizontal and vertical lines, each one orthagonal to its adjacent segments.

button.caption: Polyline
button.tooltip: The connector segments will be straight lines.

button.caption: Spline
button.tooltip: The connector segments will be curves forming an interpolating spline that passes through all control points.

checkBox.caption: Flip Flow Direction
checkBox.tooltip: Checked - The layout's flow and text direction will be set in a Right to Left reading pattern.

comboBox.caption: Sub-Graph
comboBox.tooltip: The layout of independent graphs in a model.

comboBox.caption: Group-Graph
comboBox.tooltip: The layout of independent graphs within a group in a model.

customControl.extendedCaption: Text color of the layout elements.
customControl.tooltip: Change the text color of the selected layout elements.

comboBox.tooltip: Choose the font name for the current label.

comboBox.caption: Font Size
comboBox.extendedCaption: Choose font size for an element in the layout.
comboBox.tooltip: Choose a font size for the selected elements.

button.caption: Increase Font Size
button.extendedCaption: Increase font size of the selected layout element.
button.tooltip: Increase the font size of the selected elements.

button.caption: Decrease Font Size
button.extendedCaption: Decrease font size of the selected layout element.
button.tooltip: Decrease the font size of the selected elements.

button.caption: Italics
button.extendedCaption: Apply italic formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply italic formatting to the selected elements.Available if the current font has a italic style.

button.caption: Bold
button.extendedCaption: Apply bold formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply bold formatting to the selected elements.Available if the current font has a bold style.

button.caption: Underline
button.extendedCaption: Apply underline formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply underline formatting to the selected elements.

button.caption: Left
button.extendedCaption: Apply Left Justification formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply Left Justification formatting to the selected elements.

button.caption: Center
button.extendedCaption: Apply Center Justification formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply Center Justification formatting to the selected elements.

button.caption: Right
button.extendedCaption: Apply Right Justification formatting to a layout element.
button.tooltip: Apply Right Justification formatting to the selected elements.

button.caption: Add Toolbox
button.tooltip: Add an existing toolbox to the project. The project saves a reference to the toolbox.

button.caption: New Legacy Toolbox (.tbx)
button.tooltip: Create a new legacy toolbox. The project saves a reference to the toolbox.

button.caption: New Toolbox (.atbx)
button.tooltip: Create a new toolbox. The project saves a reference to the toolbox.

button.caption: New Python Toolbox
button.tooltip: Create a new Python toolbox. The project saves a reference to the toolbox.

button.caption: ModelBuilder
button.tooltip:
Create a new blank geoprocessing model and open it in ModelBuilder.
A model is a geoprocessing workflow represented as a diagram that strings together a sequence of tools, using the output of one tool as the input to another tool. You create, edit, and manage models in ModelBuilder.Not available yet.

button.caption: Python Window
button.tooltip:
Show the Python window.
The Python window is an interpreter in which you can execute geoprocessing tools, ArcPy functions, and any other Python functionality.

button.caption: Tools
button.tooltip:
Show the Geoprocessing pane.
You can search for a specific tool, see a list of favorite and recently run tools, and explore all tools and toolboxes that are included in ArcGIS Pro.

button.caption: Geoprocessing
button.tooltip:
Show the Geoprocessing pane.
You can search for a specific tool, see a list of favorite and recently run tools, and explore all tools and toolboxes that are included in ArcGIS Pro.

button.caption: More Tools...
button.tooltip:
Show the Geoprocessing pane.
You can search for a specific tool, see a list of favorite and recently run tools, and explore all tools and toolboxes that are included in ArcGIS.

button.caption: Customize...
button.tooltip: Add groups, reorder, or remove the tools in the Analysis gallery.

button.caption: Environments
button.tooltip:
Specify the environment settings that geoprocessing tools should use.
These settings apply to all geoprocessing tools that honor the environment settings. Environments set here are saved with the project.
Common environments include: extent, output coordinate system, cell size, and raster analysis mask.

button.caption: Edit Schedule
button.tooltip: Edit existing schedule

button.caption: Run Now
button.tooltip: Run the scheduled task now

button.caption: Pause Schedule
button.tooltip: Pause/Disable the current scheduled task

button.caption: Resume Schedule
button.tooltip: Continue/Enable running the scheduled task

button.caption: Delete Schedule
button.tooltip: Deletes the scheduled task including the logs

button.caption: Clear Run Log
button.tooltip: Clear all the logs of the scheduled task

button.caption: Open
button.tooltip: Open the tool with the same parameters and settings that were previously used.

button.caption: View Details
button.tooltip: Open a window to display the details of a geoprocessing history item.

button.caption: Run
button.tooltip: Re-run the tool with the same parameters and settings that were previously used.

button.caption: Copy Python Command
button.tooltip: Copy Python code that executes the tool to the clipboard.

button.caption: Send To Python window
button.tooltip: Send Python code that executes the tool to the Python window.

button.caption: Send To Notebook
button.tooltip: Send Python code that executes the tool to an active Notebook.

button.caption: Save As Python Script
button.tooltip: Save As Python Script.

button.caption: Remove
button.tooltip: Remove from the project Geoprocessing History.

button.caption: Remove Items With Errors
button.tooltip: Remove entries from the project Geoprocessing History which did not complete successfully.

button.caption: Clear History
button.tooltip: Clear the project Geoprocessing History.

button.caption: History
button.tooltip: The geoprocessing tools you run are logged, and the list of tools is saved with your project Geoprocessing History. You can view detailed information about each tool that was run and reopen them with the same settings you previously used.

button.caption: Open
button.tooltip: Open the tool.

button.caption: Delete
button.tooltip: Delete the tool from the toolbox. The tool is permanently deleted.

button.caption: Delete
button.tooltip: Delete the toolset from the toolbox. The toolset and all of the tools it contains are permanently deleted.

button.caption: Delete
button.tooltip: Delete the toolbox. The toolbox is permanently deleted.

button.caption: Geoprocessing Options
button.tooltip: Set geoprocessing options.

button.caption: Modelbuilder Options
button.tooltip: Set modelbuilder options.

button.caption: Add To Project Favorites
button.extendedCaption: Add geoprocessing tool to Favorites in Geoprocessing pane
button.tooltip: Add this tool to the Favorites section in the Geoprocessing pane.

button.caption: Add To My Favorites
button.extendedCaption: Add geoprocessing tool to User Favorites in Geoprocessing pane
button.tooltip: Add this tool to the User Favorites section in the Geoprocessing pane.

button.caption: Add To History Favorites
button.extendedCaption: Add tool to Favorites in Geoprocessing history pane
button.tooltip: Add this tool to the Favorites section in Geoprocessing History.

button.caption: Remove From History Favorites
button.extendedCaption: Remove tool from favorites in Geoprocessing history pane
button.tooltip: Remove this tool from the Favorites section in Geoprocessing History.

button.caption: Add To Analysis Gallery
button.tooltip: Add this tool to the Analysis gallery.

button.caption: Add To Model
button.tooltip: Add this tool to the Current Model

button.caption: Remove
button.extendedCaption: Remove tool from Geoprocessing pane Favorites
button.tooltip: Remove the tool from Favorites.

button.caption: Remove
button.extendedCaption: Remove tool from Geoprocessing pane User Favorites
button.tooltip: Remove the tool from User Favorites.

button.caption: Remove
button.tooltip: Remove the tool from the Analysis gallery.

button.caption: Clear Progress
button.tooltip: Clear Progress from the Geoprocessing pane.

button.caption: Locate
button.tooltip: Go to the toolbox location of the tool.The tool cannot be located in the Geoprocessing pane.

button.caption: Edit
button.tooltip: Edit the source of the tool.This tool cannot be edited. If you wish to edit a Python Toolbox tool you must right-click and Edit the Python Toolbox.

button.caption: Batch
button.tooltip: Run the tool multiple times using multiple datasets as input or using different parameter settings.This tool does not support Batch.

button.caption: Properties
button.tooltip: Show properties for the toolbox.

button.caption: Properties
button.tooltip: Show properties for the tool.

button.caption: Help
button.tooltip: Show help for the tool.

button.caption: Task Information
button.tooltip: Open the Geoprocessing Task resource web page.

button.caption: Service Information
button.tooltip: Open the Geoprocessing Service resource web page.

button.caption: Remove From Project
button.tooltip: Remove the toolbox from the project. The project's reference to the toolbox is removed. The toolbox is not deleted.

button.caption: Make Default
button.tooltip: Make this toolbox the default toolbox for the project that is currently open.

button.caption: Add Spatial Join
button.tooltip: Create a spatial join. Joins attributes from one feature to another based on the spatial relationship.

button.caption: New Selection Layer
button.tooltip: Copy selected features to a new layer.Not available yet.

button.caption: Export Features
button.tooltip: Convert a shapefile or geodatabase feature class to a shapefile or geodatabase feature class.The selected item is not a feature layer or this layer item does not support the export data capability.

button.caption: Select By Attributes
button.tooltip: Select features by their attribute values.

button.caption: Select By Location
button.tooltip: Select features using the location of features in another layer.

button.caption: Select By Attributes
button.tooltip: Select rows by constructing an attribute query.

button.caption: By Attributes
button.tooltip: Select features by their attribute values.

button.caption: New
button.tooltip: Create a new field in this table.

button.caption: Delete
button.tooltip: Delete a field from this table.

button.caption: Add Join
button.tooltip: Join data to this layer or standalone table based on a common attribute.Joins are not available for subtype layers or stream layers.

button.caption: Geocode Table
button.extendedCaption: Geocode a table - Context Menu Item
button.tooltip: Geocode the selected table of addresses.

button.caption: Remove Join
button.tooltip: Remove joined data from the current table.

button.caption: Remove All Joins
button.tooltip: Remove all joined data from the current table.

button.caption: Add Relate
button.tooltip: Relate data to this layer or standalone table based on a common attribute. Unlike a join, a relate does not append data to the layer or standalone table.Relates are not available for non-OID tables or subtype layers or stream layers.

button.caption: Remove Relate
button.tooltip: Remove the relate from the current table.

button.caption: Remove All Relates
button.tooltip: Remove all relates from the current table.

button.caption: Script
button.tooltip: Create a new script tool in the toolbox.

button.caption: Model
button.tooltip: Create a new model in the toolbox.

button.caption: Toolset
button.tooltip: Create a new toolset in the toolbox.

button.caption: New Geometry Attributes
button.tooltip: Create new attribute fields for the input features representing the spatial or geometric characteristics and location of each feature, such as length or area and x-, y-, z-, and m-coordinates.

button.caption: Calculate Field
button.tooltip: Set the values of this field by specifying a calculation expression. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, only the values of the selected rows will be calculated.

button.caption: Summarize
button.tooltip: Create a summary table grouped by the values in the current field. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, only the values of the selected rows will be calculated.

button.caption: XY Table To Point
button.tooltip: Creates a point feature class based on coordinate values stored in the selected table.

button.caption: Make XY Event Layer
button.tooltip: Makes an event layer based on coordinate values stored in the selected table.

button.caption: Export Table
button.tooltip: Export current table to new table.This layer or standalone table item does not support the export data capability.

button.caption: Import
button.tooltip: Import symbology from another layer.

button.caption: Save
button.tooltip: Save the model edits or save the model as a new model in a new location.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Save
button.tooltip: Save the model.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Save As
button.tooltip: Save the model with a new name and new location.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Export To Graphic
button.tooltip: Export model to an image format.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Export To Python File
button.tooltip: Export model to a Python file.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Export
button.tooltip: Export a model to a graphic, a Python file or send the code to Python window.

button.caption: Send To Python Window
button.tooltip: Export model to Python and add the code to Python window.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Export Report
button.tooltip: Export model to report.

button.caption: Expand All Groups
button.tooltip: Expands all groups in a Model

button.caption: Collapse All Groups
button.tooltip: Collapses all groups in a Model

button.caption: Group
button.tooltip: Create a new empty group or add selected elements to a new group.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: UnGroup
button.tooltip: Dissolve group around elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Open
button.tooltip: Open the message window. The messages are only available after model is run in the current session.

button.caption: Zoom In
button.tooltip: Zoom into modelMake a model the active view.

button.caption: Zoom Out
button.tooltip: Zoom model outMake a model the active view.

button.caption: Fit to Window
button.tooltip: Fit model diagram to window so you can see all model elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Previous Extent
button.tooltip: Go to previous extent.

button.caption: Next Extent
button.tooltip: Go to next extent.

button.caption: Lock
button.tooltip: Locks element from being affected by Auto-Layout.Make a model the active view and select the elements to lock.

button.caption: Unlock
button.tooltip: Unlocks element so it can participate in Auto-Layout.Make a model the active view and select the elements to unlock.

button.caption: Zoom in
button.tooltip: Zoom in on the model.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Zoom out
button.tooltip: Zoom out from the model.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Auto Layout
button.tooltip: Automatically arrange the elements in a model.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Route Group Links
button.tooltip: Automatically routes the links in a group.

button.caption: Route All Links
button.tooltip: Automatically routes the links in a model.

button.caption: Route Link(s)
button.tooltip: Automatically routes the selected links in a model.

button.caption: Properties
button.tooltip: Open model tool properties.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Auto Save
button.tooltip:
Automatically saves the edited model. Click to turn the auto save on or off.
Auto save is only supported if the model was created or saved in the current product version. Use the Save button to save the model to the current version.

button.caption: Environments
button.tooltip: Specify the environment settings geoprocessing tools should use.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Report
button.tooltip: Show ModelBuilder Report.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Open Tool
button.tooltip: Open model tool in geoprocessing pane.

button.caption: Find and Replace
button.tooltip: Find and Replace.

button.caption: Cut
button.tooltip: Cut selected model elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Copy
button.tooltip: Copy selected model elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Paste
button.tooltip: Paste the cut or copied model elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Remove
button.tooltip: Remove selected connections.

button.caption: Validate
button.tooltip: Verify all data elements and parameter values are valid.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Run
button.tooltip: Run all ready-to-run processes in the model.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Intermediate
button.tooltip: Delete intermediate data from workspace.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Pan
button.tooltip: Pan in the model. Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Select
button.tooltip: Select and move model elements, and make connections.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Select All
button.tooltip: Select all model elements.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Group Select All
button.tooltip: Select all group items.

button.caption: Messages...
button.tooltip: View tool messages.

button.caption: Open...
button.tooltip: Open model element. If the element is a tool, the tool dialog is opened. If it is a variable, open the variable control to change the value assigned to the variable.

button.caption: Edit...
button.tooltip: Open model element. If the element is a tool, the tool dialog is opened. If it is a variable, open the variable control to change the value assigned to the variable.

button.caption: Parameter
button.tooltip: Remove model parameter.

button.caption: Unset Parameter
button.tooltip: Remove model parameter.

button.caption: Set Parameter
button.tooltip: Make model parameter. Model parameters are displayed when the model is opened as a geoprocessing tool. Make an output a parameter so that it is added to the map when the tool runs.

button.caption: Remove Add To Display
button.tooltip: Remove Add To Display.

button.caption: Add To Display
button.tooltip: When a model is open in the diagram view, checking Add to Display will add the output to the map and unchecking will prevent the output from being added to the map or will remove the current output from the map. To add output to display from a model tool dialog, make the output a model parameter.

button.caption: Intermediate Data
button.tooltip: When the model is open in a diagram view, checking intermediate data will delete the output after the model runs and Delete Intermediate button is clicked from the ribbon. If the model is run from the model tool dialog, anything checked as intermediate will be automatically deleted.

button.caption: Remove Intermediate Data
button.tooltip: Remove Intermediate Data

button.caption: Run
button.tooltip: Run model up to this process.

button.caption: Rename
button.tooltip: Rename.

button.caption: Variable
button.tooltip: Variables are names that store values which can be changed. These values can be layers, dataset paths, numbers, strings, or many other things.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Create Variable...
button.tooltip: Variables are names that store values which can be changed. These values can be layers, dataset paths, numbers, strings, or many other things.

button.caption: Create Label
button.tooltip: Create label.

button.caption: Suggest Tool
button.tooltip: Tools are suggested based on existing tools in the model to help create a workflow.Install Semantic Search to enable this functionality.

button.caption: For
button.tooltip: Iterates over a starting and ending value by a given value. It works exactly like For in any scripting/programming language, executing through a set number of items.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: While
button.tooltip: Works exactly like 'while' in any scripting/programming language, executing "while" a condition is true or false for the input or set of inputs.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Feature Selection
button.tooltip: Iterates over features in a feature class.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Row Selection
button.tooltip: Iterates over rows in a table.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Fields
button.tooltip: Lists all the fields from a table.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Field Values
button.tooltip: Iterates over each value in a field.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Multivalue
button.tooltip: Iterates over a list of values.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Datasets
button.tooltip: Iterates over datasets in a Workspace or Feature Dataset.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Feature Classes
button.tooltip: Iterates over feature classes in a Workspace or Feature Dataset.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Files
button.tooltip: Iterates over files in a folder.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Rasters
button.tooltip: Iterates over rasters in a Workspace or a Raster Catalog.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Tables
button.tooltip: Iterates over tables in a workspace.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Workspaces
button.tooltip: Iterates over workspaces in a folder.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Layers
button.tooltip: Iterates layers in a map.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Iterate Time
button.tooltip: Iterates over time in a date field.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Get Field Value
button.tooltip: Gets the value of the first row of a table for the specified field.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Parse Path
button.tooltip: Parses the input into its file, path, name, or extension. The output can be used as in-line variables in the output name of other tools.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Select Data
button.tooltip: Selects data in a parent data element such as a folder, geodatabase, feature dataset, or coverage.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Calculate Value
button.tooltip: Returns a value based on a specified Python expression.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Collect Values
button.tooltip: Collects output values of an iterator, or converts a list of multivalues into a single value.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Custom Message
button.tooltip: Returns a custom message.

button.caption: Merge Branch
button.tooltip: Merges two or more logical branches into a single output.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: Stop
button.tooltip: Stops iteration if all the input values meet the specified conditon of either True or False. It is functionally similar to While iterator but is useful to stop a model if there is one While iterator in a model and no additional iterators can be added.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Data Exists
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the specified data exists in the workspace.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Field Value Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the value of a field matches a specified value or evaluates if the two fields in the same data have any matching values.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Field Exists
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the input data has the specified field/s.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Selection Exists
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the data has a selection and if selected records count matches a specified value.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Row Count Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the row count of the input data matches a specified value.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Coordinate System Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the input data is projected to the specified coordinate system.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Data Type Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the input data matches the specified data type/s.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Expresssion Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates the specified expression.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Value Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the input value matches the specified criteria.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Feature Type Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the input data matches the specified feature type/s.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: If Spatial Relationship Is
button.tooltip: Evaluates if the inputs are spatially related based on a specified spatial relationship.Make a model the active view.

button.caption: New
button.tooltip:
Create a new blank geoprocessing model.
A model is a geoprocessing workflow represented as a diagram that strings together a sequence of tools, using the output of one tool as the input to another tool. You create, edit, and manage models in ModelBuilder.Not available yet.

button.caption: Save Toolbox to Version
button.tooltip: Save toolbox to a specified version

button.caption: Repair Toolbox
button.tooltip: Repair broken toolbox

button.caption: Copy
button.tooltip: Copy the selected tool.

button.caption: Paste
button.tooltip: Paste the copied tool into the toolbox.

button.caption: Edit
button.tooltip: Edit Python toolboxDecrypt toolbox to edit

button.caption: Check Syntax...
button.tooltip: Check the tools inside the toolbox for syntax errors

button.caption: Refresh Python Toolbox Access Permission
button.tooltip: Reset Python toolbox access permission and reload the toolbox.

button.caption: Add To Project
button.tooltip: Unpack a geoprocessing package and add its contents to the project. Future changes to or downloads of the package are not reflected in the project.

button.caption: Save as Model

tooltip.heading: Export Group to a New Model

button.tooltip: Takes the Group and all dependent elments and creates a submodel out of the group.

button.caption: UnGroup
button.tooltip: Dissolve group around elements.

button.caption: Rename
button.tooltip: Rename the Group.

button.caption: Create Group
button.tooltip: Adds a new Group to the current Group.

button.caption: Auto Layout Group
button.tooltip: Auto layout the group elements when a group is selected.

button.caption: Workbench
button.tooltip: Workbench is a powerful tool for data conversion, sharing, transformation, validation, and integration.Please check that the Data Interoperability Extension is installed and licensed. Administrators may download software from MyEsri according to the instructions in this article: https://support.esri.com/en/technical-article/000018698

button.caption: Data Inspector
button.tooltip: Data Inspector lets you visualize and explore any format data against an ArcGIS Online background map and optionally export all or selected features to another format.Authorize and enable the Data Interoperability Extension to access this functionality

button.caption: Quick Translator
button.tooltip: Quick Translator allows you to perform simple translations between formats or run a workspace you have previously configured.Authorize and enable the Data Interoperability Extension to access this functionality

button.caption: Spatial ETL Tool
button.tooltip: Add Spatial ETL Tool.

customControl.caption: Ready To Use Tools
customControl.tooltip: Ready-To-Use Tools use ArcGIS Online hosted data and analysis capabilities.You must be signed in to ArcGIS Online as your active portal to use these tools.

customControl.caption: Feature Analysis
customControl.tooltip: Run Feature Analysis tools on your portal. These tools use portal layers as input and create new layers hosted on your portal as output.You must be connected to a portal that has feature analysis tools.

customControl.caption: Raster Analysis
customControl.tooltip: Run Raster Analysis tools on your portal. These tools use portal layers as input and create new layers hosted on your portal as output. Additionally, use Raster Functions and the Raster Function Editor to build custom imagery and raster functions that you can submit to your portal for distributed processing. You must be connected to a portal with raster analysis tools.

button.caption: Create Building Scene Layer
button.tooltip: Create a building scene layer package from the Building Layer.

button.caption: Define Projection
button.tooltip: Change the spatial reference of the data source.

button.caption: New
button.tooltip: Create new Python Notebook.

button.caption: Python
button.tooltip: Create new Python Notebook.

button.caption: Save
button.tooltip: Save Python Notebook.

button.caption: Interrupt Kernel
button.tooltip: Interrupts the notebook kernel.

button.caption: Export To Python File
button.tooltip: Export notebook to python file.

button.caption: Export To HTML File
button.tooltip: Export notebook to HTML file.

button.caption: Export
button.tooltip: Export Notebook to Python file.

button.caption: Tools
button.tooltip:
Show the Geoprocessing pane.
You can search for a specific tool, see a list of favorite and recently run tools, and explore all tools and toolboxes that are included in ArcGIS Pro.

button.caption: Calibrate Routes
button.tooltip: Recalculates route measures using points.This tool does not support Calibrate Routes.

button.caption: Create Routes
button.tooltip: Creates routes from existing lines. The input line features that share a common identifier are merged to create a single route.This tool does not support Create Routes.

button.caption: Dissolve Route Events
button.tooltip: Removes redundant information from event tables or separates event tables having more than one descriptive attribute into individual tables.This tool does not support Dissolve Route Events.

button.caption: Locate Features Along Routes
button.tooltip: Computes the intersection of input features (point, line, or polygon) and route features and writes the route and measure information to a new event table.This tool does not support Locate Features Along Routes.

button.caption: Make Route Event Layer
button.tooltip: Creates a temporary feature layer using routes and route events.This tool does not support Make Route Event Layer.

button.caption: Overlay Route Events
button.tooltip: Overlays two event tables to create an output event table that represents the union or intersection of the input.This tool does not support Overlay Route Events.

button.caption: Transform Route Events
button.tooltip: Transforms the measures of events from one route reference to another and writes them to a new event table.This tool does not support Transform Route Events.

toolPalette.caption: Link Shape
toolPalette.tooltip: The shape of the connector used while drawing, or after Auto Layout is applied.
